document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and biogeography of the New World species of Trichadenotecnum Enderlein (Insecta: Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Psocidae)

caption.paragraph:
Figure 38. Male terminalia structures of
Trichadenotecnum slossonae
, showing terminalia in lateral view (A), epiproct in posterior view (B), hypandrium in ventral view (C) and phallosome in ventral (D) and lateral views (E).

Figure 39. Female genitalia of
Trichadenotecnum slossonae
, showing subgenital plate (A), gonapophyses (B) and internal plate (C) in ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Key to species of the slossonae group
(Females are known only for
T. slossonae
.)

paragraph.keyLead:
2. Hypandrial processes short; epiproct lobe semicircular ...................................................
T. simile Mockford

– Hypandrial processes long ( Fig. 41C ); epiproct lobe conical ( Fig. 41B )......................
T. denticulatum
sp. nov.

4. Dorsal margin of epiproct lobe deeply hollowed medially ( Fig. 38B ) .................................
T. slossonae (Banks)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mexico : Nuevo León , 20 km south Monterrey , 2 males , 3 females ,
1800 m
,
25.xii.1969
, ANGA ( UNAM )
.

Diagnosis. This species can be clearly distinguished from the other species of the group by the dorsally broadened and clearly bilobed epiproct lobe in the male ( Fig. 38B ). Female genital structures are as in Figure 39 .
